xxl.collections
Class UnmodifiableBag

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.DecoratorBag
        |
        +--xxl.collections.UnmodifiableBag
public class UnmodifiableBag
extends DecoratorBag

This class provides a decorator for a given bag that cannot be modified. The methods of this class call the corresponding methods of the internally stored bag except the methods that modify the bag. These methods (insert, insertAll and clear) throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Note that the cursor method returns an UnmodifiableCursor.

Usage example (1). 

     // create a new bag

     ListBag inputBag = new ListBag();

     // create an iteration over 20 random Integers (between 0 and 100)

     Iterator iterator = new RandomIntegers(100, 20);

     // insert all elements of the given iterator

     inputBag.insertAll(iterator);

     // create a new unmodifiable bag with the given bag

     UnmodifiableBag bag = new UnmodifiableBag(inputBag);

     // generate a cursor that iterates over all elements of the bag

     Cursor cursor = bag.cursor();

     // print all elements of the cursor (bag)

     while (cursor.hasNext())
         System.out.println(cursor.next());

     // close the open iterator, cursor and bag after use

     ((Cursor)iterator).close();
     cursor.close();
     bag.close();

See Also:
Cursor, Function, Iterator, UnmodifiableCursor

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new unmodifiable bag (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Bag). In contradiction to the contract in Bag it may only be invoked with an array (parameter list) (for further details see Function) of bags. The array (parameter list) will be used to initialize the decorated bag by calling the constructor UnmodifiableBag((Bag) array[0]).
See Also:
Function
Constructor Detail

UnmodifiableBag

public UnmodifiableBag(Bag bag)
Constructs a new unmodifiable bag that decorates the specified bag.
Parameters:
bag - the bag to be decorated.
Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
Removes all of the elements from this bag. This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
Overrides:
clear in class DecoratorBag
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - when the method is not supported.

cursor

public Cursor cursor()
Returns a unmodifiable cursor to iterate over the elements in this bag without any predefined sequence. The cursor is specifying a view on the elements of this bag so that closing the cursor takes no effect on the bag (e.g., not closing the bag).
Overrides:
cursor in class DecoratorBag
Returns:
a unmodifiable cursor to iterate over the elements in this bag without any predefined sequence.
See Also:
UnmodifiableCursor

insert

public void insert(Object object)
            throws UnsupportedOperationException
Adds the specified element to this bag. This method does not perform any kind of duplicate detection. This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
Overrides:
insert in class DecoratorBag
Parameters:
object - element to be added to this bag.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - when the method is not supported.

insertAll

public void insertAll(Iterator objects)
               throws UnsupportedOperationException
Adds all of the elements in the specified iterator to this bag. This method does not perform any kind of duplicate detection. This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
Overrides:
insertAll in class DecoratorBag
Parameters:
objects - iterator whose elements are to be added to this bag.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - when the method is not supported.

query

public Cursor query(Predicate predicate)
Returns a cursor to iterate over all elements in this bag for which the given predicate returns true. This method is very similar to the cursor method except that its result is determined by a predicate.
Overrides:
query in class DecoratorBag
Parameters:
predicate - a predicate that determines whether an element of this bag should be returned or not.
Returns:
a cursor to iterate over all elements in this bag for which the given predicate returns true.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use an UnmodifiableBag. It can also be used to test the functionality of an UnmodifiableBag.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
